contents.text: Tim is paying a short visit  to Jennifer, her mother-in-law.
contents.text_zh: 泰米短暂拜访她婆婆詹妮弗。

contents.text: I was going by the store near your house and thought of stopping for a few moments before going on home.
contents.text_zh: 我去了您家附近的商店，回家前到您这里来转转。

contents.text: I'm glad you did! Come on in! How are things going?
contents.text_zh: 你能来，我很高兴！请进！都还好吧？

contents.text: Just fine. David and I have been invited to a formal dinner at his boss's home. But I have no idea what I should ware?
contents.text_zh: 很好，大卫的老板邀请我俩参加他的正式晚宴。但我不知道该穿什么？

contents.text: If I were you. I'd wear the light blue dress David brought back from London. Your black purse and shoes go nicely with that dress.
contents.text_zh: 要是我，就会穿大卫从伦敦带回来的浅蓝色衣服，你的黑色钱包和鞋子与那件衣服很相配。

contents.text: But I can't wear that dress. Forget it!
contents.text_zh: 但我不能穿那件衣服，别提这件衣服了！

contents.text: Because it's too short. I need a more modes dress.
contents.text_zh: 因为它太短了，我需要一件更庄重的衣服。

contents.text: When David goes abroad, he always brings back nice dresses for you. Let's see ... Maybe the white dress you wore for New Year's.
contents.text_zh: 大卫出国总给你带些好衣服，让我想想....也许你新年穿的白衣服不错。

contents.text: I guess that will do! I really am lucky to have David. He's so thoughtful! He always goes beyond my expectations.
contents.text_zh: 我想是的！我嫁给大卫真幸运，他考虑得很周到！他总是让我出乎意料。

contents.text: Since this is a formal dinner, the kids can't go along with you. Would you like me to baby-sit for you?
contents.text_zh: 这是正式晚宴，孩子们不能跟着你。你把他们交给我照看，行吗？

contents.text: Sure! Your offer goes to prove that you're a wonderful mother-in-law.
contents.text_zh: 当然，您能主动帮我，真是一位好婆婆。
